trail.content:
in honor of the tumblr snap (also known as the tumblr purge). so, I’ve decided to make a good thing out of something bad.

Please enjoy you, beautiful humans.

When Peter hit 19, he and Tony came out to the public. There was an uproar. The media began throwing names out, giving Tony and Peter degrading titles.

Peter was known as a sugar baby, slut, gold digger, a victim.

Tony was called a rapist and a pedophile.

It all got to Peter, he knew people would be upset or shocked, he knew it wasn’t to go by smoothly and that people would make assumptions. His phone was constantly blowing up with death threats, as was Tony’s.

People would stop them in the streets, tell them how their relationship was gross, sinful, and people warned Peter how it wasn’t something for the long term. They would remind him of everything he already thought about and made conclusions to.

Peter knew he could handle some of it, but he didn’t expect for it to be so much. He didn’t expect people saying how they set a bad face for the company, or how maybe if Peter’s parents hadn’t died, he wouldn’t have made such a mistake in dating an older man.

Some others were targeting Aunt May, saying she did a bad job raising him, and Ben should have done better with showing him in the right direction before he had died.

It broke Peter. He found himself falling asleep that night, laying in the large king-sized bed, crying. He was thinking of everything, how people looked down on him, and no matter what he did with his life, nobody would see anything other than the fact he was in a relationship with Tony Stark.

It was dumb. He should be able to love whoever the hell he wanted to. Why did age matter? He knew for a fact Tony wasn’t using him, if Tony was using him, the billionaire would treat him like he used to treat all his other one-night-stands. Peter knew he wasn’t just one of those people. He was different - special - Tony told him that all the time.

After coming to the conclusion that he wasn’t going to fall asleep anytime soon, he got out of the empty bed, wearing Tony’s shirt and some blue flannel pajama pants and fluffy socks covering his feet. He padded his way into the lab, red, puffy eyes and a blank facial expression as he watched his boyfriend work.

Eventually the man had looked over and sighed once he saw Pete. “Hey, sweetheart,” He said, putting down the large tool he had in his hands, then wiping his hands on a rag while leaning against his work bench. “You okay?”

Peter shook his head no, trying not to cry. “No,” He said shortly, tears still threatening to spill. He could practically feel his throat closing. Tony saw the boy’s distressed and walked over to him, arms open wide.

The young man walked over and leaned into the embrace. Tony rubbed Peter’s back as Peter began to cry. “It’s not fair,” he mumbled. “Why do people care so much if I love you, or you love me, and if we love each other, and I just - it doesn’t make any sense, I- I- I just -”

Tony sighed as he put his head on top of Peter’s. “I know, I know,” Tony kept rubbing the other man’s back, trying to comfort him. Tony had gotten used to being slammed by the press over and over again for a variety of things, so it was definitely affecting him a lot less than Peter. The main thing that made him mad about the media’s reaction was how Peter was being harmed by it.

“I mean, is that all they have to talk about?” Peter said, pulling away from Tony, quickly wiping his eyes away. “I can’t walk over to May’s without someone stopping me or calling at me.”

Tony didn’t know what to say to that, instead he brought Peter into a hug, kissing the top of his head again. “It’ll be okay, it’ll die down soon,”

“Stark Industries will be having a change in power,” Tony spoke, not feeling like he had to give a reason. Yes, Pepper was holding more power than him, but him still being a large factor in the decision making was bad for the name. Many people believed the man wasn’t exactly the best at making decisions after he and Peter came out as a couple. “We’ll be electing James Rhodes, as he seems to be so involved already,”

The crowd was silent, mainly because they weren’t going to jump for joy. It didn’t matter all that much, they were just glad he wasn’t running it anymore, because even though Peter was legal, and consenting and all, for some reason they couldn’t understand that - only thinking their relationship was immoral. (a/n: ha no salt - not at all)

Either way, there was always that one guy, amongst the crowd who had to start up everything. “Mister Stark, I have a question,”

“Yes,” The man replied making sure to speak into the mic.

“Are you getting fired because of your relations with Peter Parker?”

Tony sighed into the microphone. There was no point in going there. More and more people began speaking up. Growing impatient for the murmuring to stop, Tony began tapping at the microphone lightly so a loud ‘bum bum bum’ echoed throughout the auditorium. Everyone went silent.

“Okay, didn’t get fired, I quit out of the best interest of the company, nothing involved with my relations with Peter Parker-”

More questions erupted from the crowd. “But it’s in best interest to quit because you’re dating your intern?”

“Will Peter Parker still be working at Stark Industries now that you no longer work there?”

“What does your ex-fiance, Pepper Pots say about your resignation?”

Peter watched from backstage as questions were yelled at Tony, who was trying his best to answer all of them without yelling at everyone.

This was Tony’s first appearance at any kind of public event since the one where this all started. Once again, Peter expected something bad, but nothing like this.

Peter had came to the conclusion he should prepare for the worst for now on.

More questions were barreling in, and Peter was growing increasingly mad, they were attacking him for literally backing up, doing what they wanted him to do. Some of their biggest complaints were how someone who made ‘bad decisions’ could run such a wealthy business without being prosecuted. Peter couldn’t believe they were making something out of nothing.

“Are you quitting to avoid charges being pressed against you and Stark Industries?”

Nope. That’s it. Peter had snapped.

He ran a hand through his hair and walked out from behind the the wall that was hiding him out of view from everyone. Everyone kept talking, taking notice of Peter so some of the questions were aimed towards him.

He approached the podium, “Can I?” He asked Tony, stepping up to the microphone, not really leaving Tony with much room to say ‘no,’

Peter took in a deep breath and scanned the room, everyone only speaking in hushed whispers now.

“Uh - Hi, I’m uh, Peter Parker, you know that already I’m sure, and I - um - I just wanted to say -” Peter takes a shaky breath and gathers himself a bit better. “I just wanted to say - in no way am I a victim. I am not being taken advantage of by Tony Stark. Tony Stark is not in any way, a rapist or a pedophile. Calling him such names is disrespectful and harmful to more people than just us.”

Everyone was still silent, so Peter took that as a sign to continue going.

“And trust me, if he was any of those things, and I was actually a victim, I can assure you if I was actually in any danger, or in the path of harm, my friends and family would have interjected. I don’t know why this is hard for you to grasp, it’s - the relationship - is a consensual relationship between two adults,”

People began speaking up, some louder than the others.

People kept talking an asking questions and Peter couldn’t respond to all of them, so he just took a deep breath before speaking up again. “Our relationship is legal, we’re happy. So many of you will speak of how you should be able to love whoever, but an age gap apparently draws the line. I love Anthony Edward Stark and he loves me, we’re in a regular, healthy relationship, people will have problems with it, and that’s - it’s just what it is - but what should really matter is that we’re both happy.”

Once Peter realized no one was replying Peter smiled. “Okay, thank you, um. yeah, thanks,”

He walked himself off the stage, smiling at Tony before walking backstage.

summary: You know the scene in The Avengers, where Tony says to Steve “We are not soldiers.” I noticed that Tony seemed to regret saying...
body:
You know the scene in The Avengers, where Tony says to Steve “We are not soldiers.” I noticed that Tony seemed to regret saying it, and I always thought why? he’s right and Coulson shouldn’t be reduced to just a soldier lost in battle? 

But then I realized Tony regretted it because he was staring at a man who’s been a soldier for a good chunk of his life, if not his entire life. Even as Tony and Steve are drifting apart, not that they had ever been close together, Tony still has sympathy and empathy in his heart and he doesn’t withhold it from anyone on his team.
